Description: Define typed content schemas with content collections
Do: Use defineCollection() with zod schemas for type-safe content
Don't: Manually parse frontmatter from markdown files
Code Good: const blog = defineCollection({ schema: z.object({ title: z.string() }) })
Code Bad: const posts = Astro.glob('./posts/*.md') // untyped

Description: Pages in src/pages/ auto-generate routes
Do: Create .astro files in src/pages/ for automatic routing
Don't: Manually configure routes when file-based works
Code Bad: Manual route config for simple page routes

Description: Create reusable layouts with <slot/> for consistent page structure
Do: Create base layout with head/nav/footer and use <slot/>
Don't: Duplicate header/footer in every page file
Code Bad: Copy-paste nav and footer in every .astro file

Description: Use client:* directives for interactive components only
Do: Keep most content static — add interactivity only where needed
Don't: Make entire pages interactive — defeats Astro's purpose
Code Good: <Counter client:visible /> // loads JS only when visible
Code Bad: <Counter client:load /> on every component

Description: Write static components as .astro files — zero JS shipped
Do: Use .astro components for anything without client interactivity
Don't: Use React/Vue for static content — ships unnecessary JS
Code Bad: <Card title={post.title} client:load /> for static card

Description: Pick correct hydration strategy: load/idle/visible/media/only
Do: Use client:visible for below-fold and client:idle for non-critical
Don't: Default to client:load for everything — negates Astro benefits
Code Good: <HeavyChart client:visible /> // hydrates when scrolled into view
Code Bad: <HeavyChart client:load /> // hydrates immediately on page load

Description: Only use React/Vue/Svelte when you need client interactivity
Do: Import framework components only for interactive islands
Don't: Build entire UI in React and render via Astro — overhead
Code Bad: Entire page built in React with client:load

Guideline: Pass data via props not stores
Description: Pass data to islands via props — not shared stores
Do: Serialize data as props to island components
Don't: Use global state stores across islands — complex hydration
Code Bad: useGlobalStore() across multiple islands — hydration mismatch

Description: Fetch typed content collection data with getCollection()
Do: Use getCollection() and getEntry() for content queries
Don't: Manually read files with fs or glob
Code Bad: const posts = await Astro.glob('./blog/*.md')

Description: Access component props with Astro.props in frontmatter
Do: Destructure props from Astro.props with TypeScript types
Don't: Access props without type checking
Code Good: const { title, date } = Astro.props as Props
Code Bad: const title = Astro.props.title // untyped

Description: Create JSON endpoints with src/pages/api/*.ts
Do: Use API routes for form handlers and data endpoints
Don't: Build a separate backend server for simple API needs
Code Good: export const GET: APIRoute = ({ params }) => new Response(JSON.stringify(data))
Code Bad: Separate Express server for simple API endpoint

Description: Mix static and server-rendered pages with output: hybrid
Do: Use output: 'hybrid' and mark dynamic pages with prerender = false
Don't: Force all pages to SSR when most are static
Code Good: export const prerender = false // only on dynamic pages
Code Bad: output: 'server' when 90% of pages could be static

Description: Install appropriate adapter for your hosting platform
Do: Use official adapter: @astrojs/vercel @astrojs/netlify @astrojs/node
Don't: Deploy SSR without adapter — breaks in production
Code Good: npx astro add vercel // auto-configures adapter
Code Bad: Deploy SSR to Vercel without @astrojs/vercel adapter

Description: Enable smooth page transitions with ViewTransitions
Do: Add <ViewTransitions/> in head for SPA-like navigation
Don't: Skip — pages feel like full reloads
Code Bad: No view transitions — jarring full page reloads

Description: Add meta tags and structured data for every page
Do: Use @astrolib/seo or manual meta tags for all pages
Don't: Ship pages without meta descriptions or OG tags
Code Bad: <title>My Site</title> with no description or OG tags

Description: Auto-generate sitemap.xml with @astrojs/sitemap
Do: Add @astrojs/sitemap integration for automatic sitemap
Don't: Skip sitemap — search engines miss pages
Code Bad: No sitemap.xml — Google misses half your pages

Description: Use astro:assets for automatic image optimization
Do: Use <Image/> component from astro:assets for auto-optimization
Don't: Use raw tags — no optimization
Code Bad: // no optimization, no responsive

Description: Enable link prefetching for faster navigation
Do: Use prefetch integration for instant page navigation
Don't: Disable prefetch when bandwidth is a concern
Code Bad: No prefetch — slow subsequent navigations

Description: Monitor and minimize shipped JavaScript
Do: Check bundle size — aim for <50KB JS for most pages
Don't: Ship large JS bundles for mostly-static content pages
Code Bad: 200KB+ JS bundle on a blog page

Description: Astro component styles are scoped by default
Do: Write styles in <style> tags — automatically scoped to component
Don't: Use global styles for component-specific styling
Code Bad: <style is:global>h1 { color: red }</style> for one component

Description: Add Tailwind CSS via official integration
Do: Use @astrojs/tailwind for utility-first styling
Don't: Manually configure PostCSS and Tailwind
Code Bad: Manual Tailwind setup with custom PostCSS config

Guideline: Use CSS variables for dark mode
Description: Implement dark mode with CSS custom properties
Do: Use data-theme attribute + CSS variables for theme switching
Don't: Separate dark.css file — doubles payload
Code Bad: <link href='dark.css' /> // separate dark stylesheet

Description: Use .mdx files when markdown needs interactive components
Do: Use MDX only when you need components inside markdown
Don't: Use MDX for plain text content — unnecessary overhead
Code Bad: Plain text blog post in .mdx instead of .md

Description: Extend markdown processing with remark and rehype plugins
Do: Add reading time and syntax highlighting with plugins
Don't: Build custom markdown parsers from scratch
Code Bad: Custom regex-based markdown transformation

Description: Prefer official @astrojs/* integrations over manual setup
Do: Install integrations via npx astro add [integration]
Don't: Manually configure build tools when integration exists
Code Good: npx astro add react // auto-configures React support
Code Bad: Manual React + Vite config instead of astro add react

Description: Enable strict mode in tsconfig for type safety
Do: Use strict: true and define Props interface for every component
Don't: Use any types or skip TypeScript entirely
Code Good: interface Props { title: string; date: Date }
Code Bad: const { title } = Astro.props // no type definition

Description: Create middleware for authentication and redirects
Do: Use src/middleware.ts for request-level logic
Don't: Handle auth checks in every page component
Code Good: export const onRequest = (context, next) => { if (!auth) return redirect('/login') }
Code Bad: Check auth in every page's frontmatter

Description: Use semantic HTML elements in .astro templates
Do: Use <main> <nav> <article> <section> for structure
Don't: Use <div> for everything — no semantic meaning
Code Bad: {post.title}

Description: Support system preference with manual override toggle
Do: Detect prefers-color-scheme + provide visible toggle
Don't: Light-only theme with no dark mode option
Code Bad: No dark mode support on content-heavy site

Description: Use Astro for AI-generated content sites with ISR
Do: Generate pages from AI content with on-demand rendering
Don't: Regenerate entire site for each AI content update
Code Good: export const prerender = false; const content = await generateAIContent(slug)
Code Bad: Full static rebuild for each new AI-generated post

Description: Show consent before any tracking scripts
Do: Load analytics only after explicit consent
Don't: Ship Google Analytics in <head> before consent
Code Good: Script loads conditionally after consent check
Code Bad: GA tag in every page head without consent gate

Description: Create custom 404 and 500 error pages
Do: Create src/pages/404.astro with helpful navigation
Don't: Use default Astro 404 — generic and unhelpful
Code Good: Custom 404 with search + popular links + illustration
Code Bad: Default 'Page not found' text
